qas.question: Where can you find soluble hydrogen?
What influences hydrogens solubility in metals?

answers.text: local distortions or impurities in the crystal lattice
when hydrogen is purified by passage through hot palladium disks
gas's high solubility is a metallurgical problem, contributing to the embrittlement of many metals, complicating the design of pipelines and storage tanks

context: Hydrogen is highly soluble in many <a0_0>rare earth and transition metals<a0_0/> and is soluble in both <a1_0>nanocrystalline and amorphous metals<a1_0/>. Hydrogen solubility in metals is influenced by <a2_0>local distortions or impurities in the crystal lattice<a2_0/>. These properties may be useful <a3_0>when hydrogen is purified by passage through hot palladium disks<a3_0/>, but the <a4_0>gas's high solubility is a metallurgical problem, contributing to the embrittlement of many metals, complicating the design of pipelines and storage tanks<a4_0/>.
